newsitem.title: USA: Raytheon deal hinges on chip technology - WSJ.
newsitem.headline: Raytheon deal hinges on chip technology - WSJ.

text.p: Raytheon Co is expected to receive approval by the U.S. Justice Department to go ahead with its buyout of Texas Instruments Inc's defense business if it sells or licenses to competitors its chip-making technology, the Wall Street Journal said.
In Monday's electronic edition, the Journal said such a move would likely mollify the Pentagon, which is concerned that the deal would give Raytheon a near-monopoly on the technology.

The acquisition is valued at about $3 billion. Several weeks ago, Raytheon and the Justice Department said they had agreed to delay the acquisition for two weeks, to give the agency more time to examine the proposed takeover.

Raytheon has resisted selling the technology and proposed licensing to its competitors to overcome antitrust objections. The company and the agency are apparently in negotiations over terms, the Journal said.
If the two sides are unable to reach an agreement on terms, the Justice Department would go to court to block the deal, the Journal said.
